content_html:
Kathmandu, September 21

Nepal’s national cricket players have received their visas to travel to the UAE for the historic T20I series against the West Indies.

Issuing a statement on Sunday, the Cricket Association of Nepal (CAN) confirm that the players’ visas had been approved.

According to CAN, the Nepali team will depart for the UAE on Monday.

Although the team was initially scheduled to leave for the UAE on Friday, the departure was delayed due to a delay in visa approval.

The Nepali team had already been officially bid farewell on Thursday.

The post Nepal cricket team receives visa to travel to UAE for historic T20I series against West Indies appeared first on OnlineKhabar English News.

The Nepali team had already been officially bid farewell on Thursday.
